intro: Vandellia yaoshanensis, commonly known as the Yaoshan vandellia, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as mountain forests. Its leaves are usually elliptical with a smooth surface and a dark green color. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable species for botanical research.
